marginal.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a marginal change or difference is too small to be important
marginal.translation[0].definitions[0].e: a marginal increase in the unemployment figures
marginal.translation[0].definitions[1].d: relating to a change in cost, value etc when one more thing is produced, one more dollar is earned etc
marginal.translation[0].definitions[2].d: marginal people or groups are not considered powerful or important
marginal.translation[0].definitions[2].e: The album contains too many songs by marginal bands.
marginal.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a marginal change, increase, fall etc is very small, and not enough to make an important difference
marginal.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The countryâ€™s unemployment rate declined to 7.5% in June from 7.6% in May, as a result of a marginal increase in employment.
marginal.translation[1].definitions[1].d: marginal products, activities, buildings etc are not considered to be the main part of a business or industry, but may still be important
marginal.translation[1].definitions[1].e: There will be the same number of hit movies, but an increased number of marginal films will perform poorly.
marginal.translation[1].definitions[2].d: relating to a change in a cost, value etc when one more thing is produced, one more dollar is earned etc
marginal.translation[1].definitions[2].e: The marginal return is the added output resulting from employing one more farmer.
